DOCNAME: CASE OF ERNESTINA ZULLO v. ITALY
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection rejected (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies);Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lived in GPE ( PERSON ) . She died on DATE . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE her heir , Mr PERSON ( GPE ) , informed the ORG that he intended to pursue the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought proceedings in the Benevento Magistrate 's Court , sitting as an employment tribunal , seeking acknowledgment of her right to an invalidity pension ( pensione di inabilità ) and an attendance allowance ( indennità di accompagnamento ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the magistrate 's court fixed the first hearing for DATE . On DATE the court appointed an expert and adjourned the proceedings to a hearing on DATE . The hearing was adjourned by the court of its own motion to CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the court set the case down for hearing on DATE . In the meantime , following his mother 's death , PERSON joined the proceedings .

CARDINAL . The hearing was adjourned by the court of its own motion to DATE . However , it was not held on that date because the lawyers were on strike . The CARDINAL hearings held DATE and DATE were devoted to organising new expert evidence .
CARDINAL . In a decision of DATE , the text of which was deposited with the registry on DATE , ORG , sitting as an employment tribunal , dismissed the applicant 's claim .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON appealed to ORG . The proceedings were still pending on DATE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant 's son lodged an application with ORG under PERSON no . CARDINAL of DATE , known as the “ Pinto ” Act , complaining of the excessive length of the above - described proceedings . The applicant 's son requested the court to rule that there had been a breach of LAW and to order ORG to pay compensation for the non - pecuniary damage sustained and to pay the legal costs plus those incurred before the ORG . PERSON claimed , inter alia , MONEY ( DATE ( ORG ) ) in non - pecuniary damages .

CARDINAL . In a decision of DATE , the text of which was deposited with the registry on DATE , ORG found that a reasonable time had been exceeded . It awarded ORG CARDINAL in compensation for non - pecuniary damage , ORG CARDINAL for costs and expenses incurred in the proceedings before ORG and EUR DATE of which ORG CARDINAL were fees – for the Pinto proceedings . The decision was served on the authorities on CARDINAL DATE and became binding on DATE . The authorities were given notice to comply on DATE and PERSON lodged an application for seizure with the GPE judge responsible for enforcement proceedings in DATE . Those proceedings were still pending on DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP In a letter of CARDINAL DATE PERSON informed ORG outcome of the domestic proceedings and asked it to resume its examination of his application .
CARDINAL . In the same letter the applicant 's son also informed the ORG that he did not intend to appeal to ORG because an appeal to that court could only be on points of law .
